result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Najilason Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*8-16-2022 Honorable Michelle A. Havas: Defense counsel further requests restitution be set at $0.00. No objections from the state. Court grants request and orders restitution be set at $0.00.
Hearing August 16, 2022 at 2:00 p.m.

Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
Defendant is advised he may not possess any firearms.

Mental health assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation agent.
Complete Batterers Intervention class.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation agent.  Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Mandatory fees are to be paid by 12/23/2023. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Najilason Turner

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Restitution Hearing. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defendant's appearance has been waived for the purpose of today's hearing. No restitution paperwork has been filed. Defense counsel further requests retitution be set at $ 0.00. No objections from the state. Court grants request and orders restitution be set at $ 0.00.

Defendant Jason Najilason Turner in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2:
  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to defendant's plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she and may not possess any firearms.

  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION.  COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 months.
AS TO COUNT 2: 
Defendant sentenced to serve 61 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION with 61 days time served a time served disposition.
Mandatory fees are to be paid by 12-23-2023; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent;
-absolute sobriety, 
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary  by the probation agent;
-mental health assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation agent;
-complete Batterers Intervention class;
-no contact with victim E.K.M.

Restitution hearing is scheduled for 8-16-22 at 2:00 pm.

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. -- gmb  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Court reduces bail to $2,000.00 cash with all previous conditions of bail to remain.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Jason Najilason Turner not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defense's Bail Motion.  Arguments heard as to bail.  For reasons stated on the record, Court reduces bail to $2,000.00 cash with all previous conditions of bail to remain.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Jason Najilason Turner not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests bail/bond hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with E.K.M. (6/7/86)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jason Najilason Turner in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Jason Najilason Turner in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jason Najilason Turner appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jason Najilason Turner

Prior: 3435 North 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Jason Najilason Turner appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
